nameEntry.part: National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children from Their Families

biogHist.abstract: The National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children from Their Families was established by the Federal Attorney-General in 1995. It was conducted by the Human Rights and Equal Opportunity Commission (HREOC). In April 1997, the Commission handed down the report, Bringing them Home: Report of the National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children from Their Families containing 54 recommendations.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: New South Wales Apology to the Aboriginal people of Australia for the separation of children from their families (18 June 1997)

descriptiveNote.p: The NSW apology to the Aboriginal people of Australia was a response to the National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children from their Families.
